Sentencas: One of the paramount obstacles to the commercialization of La1-xSrxGa1-yMgyO3-delta (LSGM)-based intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells is the high cost and low mechanical strength associated with the use of Ga2O3.
Titulo: Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte

Sentencas: We demonstrate in this study the use of excess Mg-doping on Ga-site as a means of lowering cost and potentially increasing mechanical strength of the final LSGM product.
Titulo: Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte
Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte

Sentencas: SEM and AC impedance spectroscopy are applied to characterize the synthesized Mg-excess La-0.8 Sr0.2Ga0.83Mg0.17 (+) O-z(3-delta).
Titulo: Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte

Sentencas: The microstructures revealed by SEM indicate an increased appearance of the Mg-rich second phase along the grain-boundaries with increasing Mg-excess level even though regular XRD could not discern the presence of this second phase.
Titulo: Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte

Sentencas: Surprisingly, the total oxide-ion conductivity of Mg-excess LSGM becomes progressively higher than the stoichiometric LSGM as the temperature increases, which is also accompanied by a gradual disappearance of the grain-boundary effect.
Titulo: Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte

Sentencas: Mechanisms of re-dissolution of the Mg-rich grain-boundary phase at elevated temperatures and formation of dopant-vacancy associates are proposed to interpret the observed compositional as well as the grain-boundary effect on the total ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte

Sentencas: Overall, no alarming adversary effect on oxide-ion conductivity of LSGM from Mg-excess doping (up to 10 mol%) has been found in this study.
Titulo: Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte
Beneficial effects of Mg-excess in La1-xSrxGa1-yMgy + zO3-δ as solid electrolyte
